Viktor Gyokeres has posted a message on his Instagram stories amid transfer speculation linking him with a move to Manchester United and Arsenal among others.
“There’s a lot of talk at the moment, most of it is false”, he said. “I will speak when the time is right”.
Spanish publication Marca claim that Marcus Rashford could take a considerable pay cut to accommodate Barcelona's financial situation.
Read more here
Manchester United have reportedly entered the race for Eintracht Frankfurt striker Hugo Ekitike.
Frankfurt are said to be demanding around £85million (€100m) for Ekitike, who has four years left on his deal.
Tom Cleverley is reportedly set to become the new Plymouth Argyle manager.
The Telegraph report that Cleverley is in advanced talks to take over at the League One club.
The former Manchester United midfielder was sacked by Watford last month.
Matheus Cunha is the first signing of a huge summer at Manchester United.

Everyone knows how important recruitment will be at Old Trafford over the next few months as the Reds look to recover from their lowest-ever Premier League finish. The absence of European football at M16 will only make that task harder.

One man who has followed Cunha's career closely in England is Wolves correspondent for the Express and Star, Liam Keen. He explains why United may have been so eager to wrap up a £62.5million deal for the Brazilian.
Read the full piece here
RB Leipzig striker Benjamin Sesko has been advised to turn down a move to Saudi Arabia after previous interest from Manchester United.
Read more here
Manchester United continue to be linked with a summer move for Sporting's Viktor Gyokeres in their search for a new striker.

The Sweden international has emerged as one of Europe's top strikers in recent years, with a remarkable record of 97 goals in 102 matches since his move from Coventry City to Liga Portugal in July 2023.

And the bookmakers at Bet365. have United as firm favourites to sign the striker at odds of 2/7. Premier League rivals Arsenal are seen as second favourites at 7/1 with the Gunners appearing to be focusing more on RB Leipzig's Benjamin Sesko instead.
Read more here

The big news this afternoon is that Matheus Cunha has formally put pen-to-paper on his transfer to United from Wolves for a £62.5million fee. It wasn't exactly a secret at Old Trafford and beyond, it must be said, but positive sings this summer already for Ruben Amorim and key figures behind-the-scenes.
Read the full story here >>>
Manchester United still remain in the fight for Victor Osimhen who is looking for a move to the Premier League.

Transfer expert Graeme Bailey told United in Focus: "We’ve known about United and Osimhen for months, and it is genuine interest. United have known his wage demands and that he is prioritising a move to England for months; he has always wanted a Premier League move.

"I understand after talking with a source close to the player that we can confirm Osimhen is not basing his decision on money, if he were, he would have accepted the Saudi offer. He does, however, believe he is one of the best strikers in world football and wants to be paid as such, which doesn’t mean he will be demanding Saudi money from United.
"He knows United are an option and he wants to come to England. Chelsea is not an option; however, I am told not to rule out Liverpool.

"While not being concerned about Champions League football, he is not going to want to come and never play Champions League. United will have sold him the project with Bruno Fernandes staying, Cunha and Mbeumo joining."

Matheus Cunha is officially through the door, then, after United triggered the release clause in his Wolves contact. Here, director of football Jason Wilcox explains why the £62.5million man was recruited for Ruben Amorim's squad;

He has proved his ability to succeed in the Premier League as one of the most exciting and productive forwards in England during his time at Wolves, and, before that, in Spain and Germany. He has all the qualities we are looking for as we seek to build a strong, dynamic and entertaining team capable of challenging for the biggest honours.

A deal for Matheus Cunha has been confirmed and he's now formally a United player. Of course, an agreement had been in place since shortly after the transfer window openong, but all the required paperwork has been done;
Manchester United are set to complete the signing of Harley Emsden-James from Southampton.
Emsden-James, 16, is highly regarded and will swap St. Mary's Stadium for Old Trafford this summer.
The young defender has played for England at youth level and will join United's academy. Southampton will receive compensation and Jason Wilcox has played an important role in the move.
Manchester United are continuing to monitor Jean-Philippe Mateta’s situation at Crystal Palace, even after heavy summer spending.

The Red Devils have already splashed £62.5m on Matheus Cunha and submitted a £45m bid - plus £10m in add-ons - for Bryan Mbeumo. Yet, according to former chief scout Mick Brown via Football Insider, Mateta remains on United’s radar as Ruben Amorim looks to bolster his attacking options.
The 27-year-old’s current deal at Palace runs until 2027, but the club have reportedly opened talks over a contract extension amid growing transfer interest.
As the unfolding drama between Gyokeres and Sporting intensifies, the Lisbon club's president Frederico Varandas has promised the striker that things will only get worse before they get better.
He explained on Wednesday:

You should know me better by now. Threats, blackmail, insults, they don’t work with me. And I can guarantee one thing, Viktor Gyokeres will not leave for 60 plus 10. He won’t leave (for that amount) because I never promised him that and with this game that the agent is playing, the situation will only get worse.

Napoli sporting director Giovanni Manna has already suggested the Italian club will not pay over the odds for Manchester United winger Alejandro Garnacho should they rekindle their interest this summer.
Napoli saw a £40million bid for the United ace turned down in the January transfer window after identifying him as one of their top targets to strengthen their wide options.

Their offer fell short of United's valuation of the 20-year-old, who has been informed he is free to leave Old Trafford this summer if the club receives an acceptable offer. It is believed a fair market value for him would be somewhere between £50m and £60m...
Arsenal are reportedly preparing to submit the first official bid for Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyokeres.
The Gunners are battling Manchester United for the Swedish forward, but it appears Mikel Arteta's side are ready to take the lead in the race.
According to A Bola, Arsenal’s sporting director Andrea Berta has held positive talks with Gyokeres’ representatives, with the north London club now said to be 'in a hurry' to secure the deal.
Aston Villa are reportedly looking to secure Jadon Sancho on a loan deal - but Manchester United aren't interested.
According to The Sun, Villa have been monitoring Sancho's situation and would be interested in taking the Englishman on a temporary deal.
Unfortunately for Unai Emery's team, with United's current financial situation, the club are ideally looking for a cash move to give Ruben Amorim further funds to rebuild his squad.
Real Betis CEO Ramon Alarcon has confirmed that discussions are underway regarding a potential permanent move for Manchester United winger Antony.

The Brazilian enjoyed a revitalised spell on loan at the La Liga club, impressing Betis enough for senior figures to act. Alarcon, alongside sporting director Manu Fajardo, reportedly met with United representatives to explore the possibility of a transfer.

Speaking to Estadio Deportivo, Alarcon said: “Working, working… It’s still very early. We’re going little by little, as there’s still a lot of market space to be filled. This is very long, and it hasn’t even really begun."

Bulka, who represents Ineos' other top tier club Nice, was first choice for the French club this season and did not miss a Ligue 1 match as they finished fourth and entered the Champions League qualifying stage.
The 25-year-old has emerged as a target at a time when Onana is under ever-increasing scrutiny following a rollercoaster season at Old Trafford.
MEN Sport understands a new goalkeeper addition could be possible for the Reds this summer.
Despite United's interest and Sporting changing their financial demands for the striker, Arsenal are reportedly not giving up on a move for Gyokeres this summer.
Football Italia understands that Arsenal's sporting director Andrea Berta is keen to sign not only Benjamin Sesko but Gyokeres this summer too.
It is claimed that talks between the north London club and Gyokeres have reopened in the past few hours.
While the Swedish striker remains 'unhappy' with Sporting for their behaviour towards his exit, United have received a boost in their planned approach for him.
Sky Sport Italia reports that Serie A clubs do not see Gyokeres as a viable option in the summer transfer window.
It is claimed that the forward is 'destined for other shores' with the Premier League seen as his likely destination.
Despite the blow from Dortmund regarding their interest, it appears that a door remains open for Sancho in the Premier League... or perhaps three of them.
According to The Mirror, Aston Villa, Newcastle and Tottenham Hotspur are all interested in Sancho this summer.
All three moves would be considered by Sancho as good options with Newcastle and Spurs in the Champions League and Villa in the Europa League.
With the West Midlands club likely to miss out on Rashford this summer, Sancho could be seen as a good alternative for them.
Borussia Dortmund's sporting director Sebastian Kehl has played down reports that the Bundesliga club are pushing hard to sign Sancho this summer.
Speaking ahead of their flight out to the Club World Cup, Kehl admitted that Dortmund remain close to Sancho but he is not currently a top target.
As quoted by Get Football News Germany, Kehl explained:

Of course, contact with Jadon is always there, in some way, because we have a very long history,” said Kehl. “But it’s not an issue for us right now. We have other priorities at the moment and that’s why the Sancho issue was probably played up more in the media than discussed internally.
Despite Arsenal understood to be pushing hard for Gyokeres this summer, it is United who remain leading the way for his signature with bet365.
The bookmaker sees it as a two-horse race for the Swede with United leading the way on 5/4 while Arsenal are just behind on 15/8.
Juventus are next on the list to sign the striker but they are priced quite far back at 7/1.
Away from transfer news briefly, the new Manchester United home kit for the 2025/26 season has been released.
Created by Adidas, the shirt features a custom sleeve print which harks back to the kits of the mid to late '90s.

headline: Why Manchester United wanted Matheus Cunha as £62.5million transfer completed
body: Manchester United's director of football Jason Wilcox has described Matheus Cunha as "one of the most exciting and productive forwards in England" following completion of his move to Old Trafford.
United announced they had signed the attacker from Wolves on June 1 after triggering his £62.5million release clause, subject to him obtaining a visa and registration.
United have now wrapped up the transfer, and Cunha has signed a five-year deal at Old Trafford, with the option of an additional 12 months.
The Reds pinpointed the 26-year-old as one of their top targets for this summer's transfer window several months ago and he is expected to occupy the left-sided No.10 position at Old Trafford.
"Bringing in Matheus was one of our main priorities for this summer, so we are delighted to have completed his signing so early in the window," Wilcox said.
"He has proved his ability to succeed in the Premier League as one of the most exciting and productive forwards in England during his time at Wolves, and, before that, in Spain and Germany.
"He has all the qualities we are looking for as we seek to build a strong, dynamic and entertaining team capable of challenging for the biggest honours."
Cunha has joined United following a stellar 2024/25 campaign at Wolves in which he scored 17 goals across all competitions, including 15 in the Premier League.
He has scored 27 goals in the top flight since the beginning of the 2023/24 campaign.

headline: Viktor Gyokeres to Man United transfer latest as Hugo Ekitike bombshell claims emerge
body: Manchester United are caught in the eye of a transfer storm with Sporting CP's Viktor Gyokeres vying for a move to the Premier League, though word has started to emerge of interest in a new striker.

Managed by Ruben Amorim at the Estadio Jose Alvalade over the course of 2023/24 plus the first months of last season, 27-year-old Gyokeres scored 66 of his 97 goals for Sporting. It is that contribution towards the winning of three trophies that have elevated his status as an elite striker, all building up to the current summer transfer window.

Man United, having wrapped up top No.10 target Matheus Cunha's arrival, have turned their attention towards adding a confident goalscorer to their ranks and even without Champions League football to offer, have been linked with making a daring move for Gyokeres.
However, such a plan could quickly come undone based on the latest word out of Portugal.
Mais Futebol have provided the bombshell claim that Premier League rivals Arsenal have now submitted an offer for the Sweden international.

It is said to be a guaranteed sum below €60m (£51m) with bonuses that will take the overall agreement higher. This is far below the €80m (£68.1m) the Portuguese champions are reportedly holding out for.

Such a development would truly be astonishing as sister site football.london had gathered intel that it was RB Leipzig's Benjamin Sesko, 21, that the North London club were making progress towards signing have elected he to be the top target having initially done homework on the terms for both he and Gyokeres' deals.
The Frenchman, 22, scored 22 goals for the Bundesliga side last season and has already been tied to both Liverpool and Chelsea in rumours
He says Old Trafford chiefs have established contact in the last 48 hours to gather the necessary information about a former Paris Saint-Germain player tipped to move for €100m (£85m).

There had also been warning that the Gunners were making their advance ahead of Man United had been floated when CNN Portugal, via The Mirror, had reported that the player's agent, Hasan Cetinkaya, had met with officials from the Emirates Stadium last night.
The whole situation had taken a turn before that once it began to be reported that Sporting were in fact holding out for an €80m (£68.1m) fee.

Gyokeres was said to be 'furious' with the stance of his club as for a long time, even dating back to the winter, it was suggested the Swede had a 'gentleman's agreement' in place that would mean they would lower the asking price to €69m (£59m) and not block his exit path were a suitable suitor to emerge.

If Arsenal - with the ability to offer a stronger shot at the Premier League title at present plus Champions League football - are advancing, it is all bad news for Man United, who have already lost out on top target Liam Delap to Chelsea.

headline: Tottenham appoint former Man United man as huge new announcement made
body: Tottenham Hotspur have confirmed that former Manchester United coach Andreas Georgson has joined Thomas Frank's backroom staff at Spurs.

The Swede is a set-piece coach who has worked with Frank previously before moving on to Arsenal and then the Reds. Georgson joined United in July and was retained by Ruben Amorim following the dismissal of Erik ten Hag in October.
And Georgson will now reunite with Frank in north London after the former Brentford boss was confirmed as Ange Postecoglou's successor at Tottenham on Thursday evening.
"We are delighted to announce the appointment of Thomas Frank as our new Head Coach on a contract that runs until 2028," Spurs' statement confirming the news read.
"Thomas has extensive experience in English football having joined Brentford in 2016 - since becoming one of the longest-serving current managers in the Premier League.

"During his time at Brentford he transformed the club, moving them up from the Championship to an established Premier League side, consistently and significantly outperforming expectations for an extended period of time.

"In Thomas we are appointing one of the most progressive and innovative head coaches within the game. He has a proven track record in player and squad development and we look forward to him leading the team as we prepare for the season ahead.

"Thomas will be joined from Brentford by Justin Cochrane (First Team Assistant Coach), Chris Haslam (Head of Performance & First Team Assistant Coach) and Joe Newton (First Team Coach Analyst), with Andreas Georgson (First Team Assistant Coach) arriving from Manchester United."

headline: Viktor Gyokeres breaks silence amid Man United transfer twist and Sporting fury - 'I will speak'
body: Manchester United-linked Viktor Gyokeres has broken his silence on social media as speculation surrounding his future at Sporting intensifies.

Gyokeres has emerged as one of Europe's finest No. 9s in recent seasons with a staggering 97 goals in 102 matches since his move from Coventry City to Liga Portugal in July 2023. The forward scored 39 of those goals in the league this season, to help Sporting win the league and cup double.
The 27-year-old reportedly has a gentleman's agreement to leave Sporting this summer for offers above £58 million (€70m) despite a release clause of around £84m (€100m).
However, club president Frederico Varandas revealed on Wednesday that no promises were made to Gyokeres about letting him leave for a cheaper deal this summer.
And Gyokeres has since issued an update on social media. "There is a lot of talk at the moment, most of it is false," he said on Instagram stories. "I will speak when the time is right."
It is unclear whether missing out on Delap will lead United to turn towards Gyokeres instead, amid reports in Portugal on Thursday that Arsenal have submitted a bid for the Swedish star.

Portuguese publication Maisfutebol claim that the Gunners are willing to pay a fixed amount below €60m (around £51m) plus bonuses. It is claimed that despite the initial impasse, negotiations between both clubs are expected to continue in the coming days.

headline: Viktor Gyokeres 'move' made after Man United transfer 'approach' as response given
body: Arsenal have reportedly made a formal offer for Manchester United-linked Viktor Gyokeres.

The Swedish international has risen to prominence as one of Europe's leading strikers in recent years, boasting an impressive tally of 97 goals in 102 matches since his move from Coventry City to Liga Portugal in July 2023.

Sporting's top goal scorer this season has made a significant impact in the Portuguese top-tier, netting 39 goals and providing eight assists in 33 appearances. The 27-year-old has been a pivotal player in Rui Borges' squad, driving Sporting to another league title and cup victory.
Gyokeres reportedly has a gentleman's agreement to leave Sporting this summer for offers above £58million (€70m) despite a release clause of around £84m (€100m).

And Portuguese publication Maisfutebol claim that Arsenal are willing to pay a fixed amount below €60m (around £51m) plus bonuses. It is claimed that despite the initial impasse, negotiations between both clubs are expected to continue in the coming days.
It is also said that United are ready to make a similar offer for the player Amorim knows well from their time at Sporting together.
The reports come after Sporting president Frederico Varandas revealed no promises were made to Gyokeres about letting him leave for €60m this summer.
"It was agreed that Sporting would not demand the release clause at the end of the season, especially because he was going to be 27," Varandas said.
"We knew about Viktor's dream of going to a club where he could fight for the Champions League and we have common sense.
"We guaranteed that we would not demand €100m. Sporting has common sense, it keeps its word.

"The president of Sporting said that the club would not demand the clause and that we would adjust the value to Viktor's performance, he was one of the best players ever to step on the pitch in Portugal."

headline: Mason Mount sends perfect two-word message as Man United transfer completed
body: Mason Mount has taken to social media to wish Matheus Cunha well after he completed a move to Manchester United.
Just days after the Premier League season finished, United moved quickly to sign the Brazilian from Wolverhampton Wanderers by triggering the £62.5m release clause in his contract.
The 26-year-old was one of the standout performers this season, scoring 15 goals and providing six assists to help the Midlands outfit to a 16th-place finish in the Premier League.
On Thursday afternoon, United confirmed that all the paperwork for the deal had been completed and the forward had penned a five-year deal at Old Trafford.
Shortly after that announcement, Mount, who made the move to United from Chelsea two years ago, shared a snap of Cunha signing his contract on Instagram with the caption: "Welcome brother!"

Speaking as a Man United player for the first time, Cunha said: "It is hard to put into words my feelings about becoming a Manchester United player. Ever since I was a child in Brazil watching Premier League games on TV at my grandmother’s house, United was my favourite English team and I dreamed of wearing the red shirt.
"I want to thank my family and everyone who has helped me make that dream a reality.

“I can’t wait for the start of pre-season to get to know my team-mates and prepare for the season ahead. All my focus is now on working hard to become a valuable part of the team, and helping get this club back to the top.”
United's director of football, Jason Wilcox, added: “Bringing in Matheus was one of our main priorities for this summer, so we are delighted to have completed his signing so early in the window.

"He has proved his ability to succeed in the Premier League as one of the most exciting and productive forwards in England during his time at Wolves, and, before that, in Spain and Germany. He has all the qualities we are looking for as we seek to build a strong, dynamic and entertaining team capable of challenging for the biggest honours.”

headline: Manchester United can repeat Ayden Heaven and Chido Obi trick with latest signing
body: Manchester United are closing in on the signing of highly-rated Southampton youngster Harley Emsden-James to continue a recent transfer trend.

The 16-year-old centre-back is poised to make the switch to Old Trafford this summer after the two clubs agreed a compensation package. A report by the Daily Echo has claimed the fee will be a 'minimum of £1million'.
It is understood Jason Wilcox - United's director of football - played a key role in getting the deal in place. Wilcox worked at St Mary's before moving to Old Trafford last year.

United have developed a habit for signing some of the country's hottest prospects since Ineos took control of football operations last year, with the club's recruitment strategy improving for the better under their stewardship.
Hungry to sign young players with potential before they have announced themselves to the wider world, United are attempting to swoop for young talent in low-risk, high-reward deals.
The Reds did that on at least three occasions during the 2024/25 campaign, signing midfielder Sekou Kone from Malian club Guidars FC before swooping for Arsenal duo Chido Obi and Ayden Heaven.

Obi and Heaven have already made their first-team debuts at Old Trafford and the latter is already in the conversation to be a regular starter at centre-back next season. Obi will also be keen for more opportunities after impressing in a handful of cameo outings and scoring twice against Hong Kong on the post-season tour.
Obi joined United after he turned down the offer of a new deal at Arsenal and he signed his first professional contract at Old Trafford after celebrating his 17th birthday in November.
Heaven was signed for a minimal fee in the January transfer window and was considered as a first-team signing despite only making one senior appearance during his time at Arsenal.

United have high hopes for both of them and they will each for pushing for an increase in first-team minutes in 2025/26. If they are successful in their efforts, United's low-risk, high-reward transfer strategy will be fully vindicated.

headline: Manchester United cannot afford to repeat transfer mistake with dream summer signing
body: The start of Manchester United's pre-season campaign will be here before we know it.

United are scheduled to play the opening game of their pre-season programme on Saturday, July 19, facing Leeds United in Stockholm. They will then travel to the United States for their pre-season tour a few days later.

United will play three games in the US, facing West Ham United, Everton and Bournemouth as part of the Premier League Summer Series. After returning to home soil, they will wrap up their pre-season schedule with a clash against Fiorentina at Old Trafford.

This will mark the third summer in a row that United have jetted off to the US for their pre-season tour. On the previous two, with the exception of just one game, United have been starved of an out-and-out centre-forward.

Rasmus Hojlund arrived from Atalanta in August 2023 after United had returned from the US and he got injured in the opening game of last summer's pre-season tour, meaning he has not had a full pre-season since arriving at Old Trafford.

He will desperately be hoping it is third time lucky for him this summer, although Inter Milan's interest in his signature could see him shipped out of Old Trafford before United board their flight to the US in the fourth week of July.

With United prepared to sell any player this summer, they are unlikely to stand in the 22-year-old's way if an enticing offer is presented to them. He scored just ten goals in 2024/25 and patience with him is wearing increasingly thin.

Whether Hojlund departs or not, it is no secret by now that United are desperate to sign a striker. However, after missing out on Liam Delap, it remains to be seen which direction that search will head in.

They continue to be linked with the likes of Sporting Lisbon's Viktor Gyokeres and Victor Osimhen of Napoli, with both seemingly destined to move this summer, but no formal offers for a striker have yet been tabled by the Reds, with their focus currently on trying to sign Bryan Mbeumo from Brentford.

United have already strengthened their attack by signing Matheus Cunha from Wolves for £62.5million, and Mbeumo is likely to command a similar fee, but ending the summer without recruiting an out-and-out No.9 can't be an option.
The transfer window will temporarily close at 7pm this evening (Tuesday), but will reopen again as soon as next Monday.

Once the window reopens, United need to try and step up their efforts in the seller's market. They want exits to reach double figures this summer and they have a crop of players within their ranks they want to sell who could bring in useful fees.

United have identified Marcus Rashford, Jadon Sancho and Antony as priority sales, while Alejandro Garnacho has been informed he can leave. Selling any player is an easier-said-than-done task, of course, but if United were to successfully offload the aforementioned quartet, they would be looking to bank over £100m.

That would give them a huge boost in their quest to sign a striker. Gyokeres is set to cost north of £60m and he is currently looking as though he could be the most likely candidate to strengthen Ruben Amorim's front line.

Whether it be Gyokeres or an alternative centre-forward, it would be ideal if United could get a deal wrapped up in time to take their new chief goalscorer on the pre-season tour. That adaptation period can be so crucial for players ahead of the competitive action kicking off in August.

Getting a new striker in ahead of the season starting would give Amorim the opportunity to see how he bonds and forms on-field relationships with his new teammates. United were playing catch-up in 2023 and Joshua Zirkzee did not go on last summer's pre-season tour after being granted a period of leave following his participation at Euro 2024 with the Netherlands.

With the Club World Cup taking place over the coming weeks, the summer break is bound to feel as though it is going that little bit quicker. It means the clock is ticking for United to secure their most important jigsaw piece.

headline: Manchester United defender shares emotional message after exit confirmed
body: Outgoing left-back Sam Murray has thanked everyone at Manchester United for their support after it was announced he will be leaving the club this summer.
United issued their end-of-season retained list on Monday and confirmed that Murray is one of nine players who will be leaving Old Trafford when his contract expires at the end of June.
Murray is one of six academy players to have been informed he will be released at the end of the month. He joined United from Huddersfield Town back in 2017.

The left-back, who will turn 21 in September, was a regular fixture for United's Under-21s and Under-18s throughout his time at the club. He helped the Under-18s win the FA Youth Cup back in 2022, playing a key role from left-back.
Posting a farewell message on his Instagram page, he said: "After seven years, my time at Manchester United has come to an end.
"I would like to thank everyone at the club for your support, especially my coaches and teammates over the years.
"It's been a privilege to represent this club, and I will forever be grateful for the opportunities and experience this club has given me. I wish everyone the best of luck for the future.
"Once a red.
"Muz."

Murray signed his first professional contract at United in May 2023 and was taken to Spain by former United manager Erik ten Hag in December 2022 for the club's mid-season training camp and friendlies against Cadiz and Real Betis.
Ten Hag also took Murray to Norway for last summer's pre-season opener against Rosenborg and he was awarded a start at left-back. However, he never made a competitive appearance for the club.

headline: What Matheus Cunha did for Brazil speaks volumes for Man United after Wolves transfer
body: New Manchester United signing Matheus Cunha continued his blistering form onto the international stage as he was the inspiration in Brazil's win. The former Wolves attacker was at the centre of the action was they booked their place in the World Cup ahead of the competition next year.

Cunha started and managed 79 minutes as they overcame Paraguay with a 1-0 win to book their spot with two games to spare. The 26-year-old played a key part in the win as he provided the assist in the only goal of the game for Vinicius Jr.
The United summer signing was superb in the move after swooping in on a loose ball following Raphinha's run forward.
Cunha raced through before firing across the face of goal where the Real Madrid star powered the ball home.

The £62.5million attacker created the most chances during the contest to hand Carlo Ancelotti his first win since leaving Real Madrid for Brazil, following the goalless draw against Ecuador last time out - where the 26-year-old was a second-half introduction.
With Cunha's inspirational performance, Brazil became the only team to qualify for every World Cup tournament since it was formed in 1930.
The Brazil players and the new United attacker will embark on their respective breaks before returning for pre-season.

Ruben Amorim's side will take on Leeds in mid-July, then travel to America for the Premier League Summer Series, where they will play West Ham, Bournemouth and Everton before rounding off their preparations at home to Fiorentina.

United supporters will get a first-look at the squad for the upcoming campaign at Old Trafford on August 9 as they look to bounce back from their torrid camping, which saw them finish just three places above the relegation zone.
Speaking about the prospect of working alongside Amorim, Cunha said: "Talking about him [Amorim] is easy.
"I think he's a great coach and I wish him nothing but the best.
"I hope he conquers the world as he did Portugal.
"God willing, we'll always do our best to help."
Prior to the international break, Cunha travelled to Manchester to finalise a five-year contract with the option of a further year.

headline: Bryan Mbeumo signs, Viktor Gyokeres deal - Man United dream transfer window as deadline passed
body: Manchester United will have to wait a few days before being able to resume their transfer business for the summer.

The first phase of the summer window is now closed, meaning United are not officially able to get deals over the line. The transfer window was open from June 1-10 thanks to the FIFA Club World Cup this summer.

United have already got one deal over the line with Matheus Cunha arriving in a £62.5million move from Wolves. The Brazilian is not the only player to be linked with a move to United, though, but that will have to wait for later in the summer.

The transfer window will open again on June 16 and will remain so until it closes on September 1 until the New Year. For the time being, United have an opportunity to take stock and weigh up what deals they want to complete when the window reopens once again.
It won't just be new signings that United will be focused on this summer, but also players who could leave the club.

United will want to raise funds via player sales in order to reinvest in the squad ahead of next season. Marcus Rashford, Antony and Jadon Sancho all spent time away from Old Trafford on loan last season and could all leave on permanent deals this summer.
Rasmus Hojlund could also leave United this summer amid reported interest from Serie A outfit and Champions League finalists Inter Milan.
United are interested in signing Brentford star Bryan Mbeumo, but will have to wait until the second transfer window to be able to get a deal over the line.

An opening bid worth up to £55millioj from United was rejected by the Bees earlier this month, but the interest in Mbeumo is still there. The Cameroon international has also been heavily linked with Tottenham Hotspur in recent days.
If United can agree a deal with Brentford for Mbeumo to complete a move to Old Trafford later this month, that would certainly kickstart the second transfer window in ideal fashion.
United have been heavily linked with signing a striker for months, and Viktor Gyokeres is one player who has been mentioned regularly at the top of the list.

Gyokeres has a €100million (£84million) release clause in his contract at Sporting Lisbon but is reportedly available for around £60million this summer. The striker has been linked with several of Europe's biggest clubs this summer, many of which have Champions League football as a key selling point going into next season.

United will be aware that convincing Gyokeres to join the club this summer without any European football to offer may be a difficult task. But if the Old Trafford hierarchy can somehow agree a deal, it would certainly be a major boost going into next season.

The goalkeeping department was a regular talking point at United last season. Andre Onana is the first-choice shot-stopper at Old Trafford and has Altay Bayindir as his understudy, but both players have been linked with moves away over the last few months.

It remains to be seen which two goalkeepers United will have going into next season. Tom Heaton could leave the club this summer when his contract expires, although United have confirmed that talks are ongoing over a new deal.

Only Amorim and those within the Old Trafford hierarchy will know what the plans will be for the goalkeeper position going into next season. Only time will tell if United want to sign a new goalkeeper or if they will continue with their current three options for another year.

headline: Manchester United can't ignore Roy Keane in the summer transfer window - 'He is not good enough'
body: When Manchester United swooped for Rasmus Hojlund from Atalanta in August 2023, it goes without saying that they paid over the odds.
In his first and only season at the Italian club, the Dane scored ten goals in 34 appearances across all competitions. It was a respectable return, but it was by no means eye-catching.
However, United made the decision to pay £64million for his signature. The package could still rise to £72m.

United, who had been interested in Harry Kane earlier in the window, were in desperate need of a striker and their search eventually led them to Hojlund. However, they bought potential rather than a finished product.

He arrived at Old Trafford as an incredibly raw 20-year-old who suddenly had the weight of the world on his shoulders. He had been brought in to strengthen an attack that had been too reliant on Marcus Rashford in the 2022/23 campaign.

In truth, the jump from being a starting striker at Atalanta to being a starting striker at United was just too big for the Dane at such a young age. With the exception of the injury-prone Anthony Martial, Hojlund did not have anyone he could lean on for guidance or support.

Despite that, he plundered a respectable 16 goals in his maiden season in England, and there was hope he would build on that tally in 2024/25. However, his performances regressed and he scored just ten goals, of which only four were netted in the Premier League.

It further highlighted the feeling that Hojlund should have been signed to perform the role of United's secondary striker. Martial's injury record meant the Denmark international immediately had to step up and shoulder United's goalscoring burden.
"He is not good enough. He is lacking in confidence and belief and he is not surrounded by brilliance either.
"If people think they can fix that in one summer, it is not going to happen."

Since making that admission after United were beaten 1-0 by Chelsea at Stamford Bridge almost four weeks ago, United have learnt of interest from Inter Milan in Hojlund's signature. United are prepared to sell any player this summer and the striker is one of the more likely candidates to be moved on to raise funds for new additions.

Whether Hojlund stays or goes, United desperately want to recruit a new No.9 this summer. Despite originally targeting Liam Delap, there is a need for them to recruit someone who is an established goalscorer and ready to hit the ground running.
Much of the current speculation centres around Viktor Gyokeres of Sporting Lisbon and Napoli striker Victor Osimhen. Both are proven goalscorers who have hit brilliant numbers in recent seasons.
It is a striker of that ilk that United need to be signing this summer, as opposed to another striker in the bracket of Hojlund, who was recruited based on potential.

Keane was right that Hojlund should have been signed to provide competition and not be the frontman of United's attack. This summer it feels almost inevitable that United will go down the right route when trying to bring in a No.9.

headline: Antony Man United transfer exit edges closer thanks to Liverpool Florian Wirtz agreement
body: Erik ten Hag could reportedly offer Antony a lifeline at Bayer Leverkusen after Liverpool reached a verbal agreement to sign Florian Wirtz.

On Tuesday evening, reports emerged that Liverpool had reached a verbal agreement in principle with Leverkusen on a deal worth €150 million (£127m), including add-ons. The German international is now set for a medical.
That has left the German club looking for alternative options to strike a deal once the transfer window reopens on Monday, June 16.
According to BILD, Leverkusen won't pursue a marquee signing costing €50m (£42m) or more to replace Wirtz.
Instead, they plan to bring in multiple players who can immediately strengthen the squad.
Several targets have been identified offensively, with Antony reportedly being one of them.
The report adds that AC Milan's Malick Thiaw, who is expected to cost around €23m (£19m), is 'high on the list', while Nico Paz is desired in midfield and would cost around €30m (£25m).

Ten Hag, who has recently replaced Xabi Alonso in the hot seat at Leverkusen, could be reunited with Antony. The Brazilian was brought to Old Trafford from Ajax in 2022, when Ten Hag was in charge at the club.
The pair previously enjoyed a successful spell together in Amsterdam.

However, Antony struggled to hit the ground running at United and was loaned to Real Betis during the 2024/25 season, where he made a significant impact with numerous impressive performances and goals in La Liga.
Meanwhile, the same outlet reports that United are open to offers between €25-€30m (£21-25m) for Antony, despite late-season claims that the club was confident of securing a fee of at least £40m.
United would require £32.52m for Antony to avoid a loss under the Premier League's profitability and sustainability rules.

headline: RAILSTON: Bryan Mbeumo to Manchester United transfer latest ahead of first deadline
body: Manchester United are not expected to make any progress in Bryan Mbeumo talks by the first summer transfer deadline.
United submitted an opening offer of £45million with a further £10million in add-ons for Mbeumo, but it fell short of Brentford’s valuation and talks are continuing between the clubs.
There is no update on Mbeumo expected by the first summer transfer deadline. The summer transfer window opened on June 1 and will close again Tuesday, June 10.
The transfer window will reopen on Monday, June 16, and remain open until the newly announced deadline day time of 7pm on Monday, September 1.
United would like to wrap up a deal for Mbeumo as soon as possible so he can report for the start of pre-season at Carrington in July.
Mbeumo contributed 20 goals and eight assists in the Premier League last season, predominantly playing on the right wing but also making a handful of appearances down the middle.
United, Arsenal, Tottenham and Newcastle have been linked with a deal for Mbeumo this summer, but the player has indicated that he would prefer a move to Manchester.
Tottenham are closing in on the appointment of Thomas Frank, who has overseen Mbeumo's development at Brentford, but the player is understood to be keen on a move to Old Trafford.
Mbeumo is about to enter the final year of his Brentford contract, although the London club have the option of triggering a one-year extension in his deal.
United are targeting at least three priority signings, with the £62.5m signing of Matheus Cunha already confirmed.

headline: Angry Amorim has ‘weakened’ Man Utd ‘negotiating position’ for Red Devil as big discount now on
body: A rant from Ruben Amorim has reportedly ‘weakened’ the negotiating position of Manchester United for one of their players, meaning his value might have dropped by £20million.

United are willing to let a number of their attackers leave this summer. The likes of Antony, Jadon Sancho, Alejandro Garnacho and Marcus Rashford will all be able to leave if the Red Devils can find suitors for them.
For Garnacho, it seems that won’t be a problem, as Chelsea, Bayer Leverkusen, Napoli and AC Milan are among those linked with him.

However, United have seemingly backed themselves into a corner. Manager Amorim reportedly tore Garnacho to pieces in front of his team-mates – after the winger had called the club’s season sh*t in an interview.
He is reported to have made no illusions about the star’s future, stating: “You better pray that you can find a club to sign you.”
But according to GIVEMESPORT, that has put United in danger of having to offload Garnacho below their initial demands.

It’s said the Manchester outfit could be forced to sell the winger at a discount of £20million or more, as Amorim’s decision to single Garnacho out as a player needing to head through the door has ‘weakened their negotiating position’.
Indeed, admirers have given indications that they are not willing to match Garnacho’s price tag since Amorim’s angry rant.
Each of the interested sides will look to secure a cut-priced deal as they seek to take advantage of the ‘strong desire’ for United to get him off the books.
It’s previously been stated that the Red Devils were hopeful of making £70million from Garnacho, but the report states that there’s no indications that clubs are even willing to pay £50million.
It is not clear what clubs would be willing to pay, and who will have the upper hand of the interested sides.

However, United’s desire for an early solution in the Garnacho saga has also gone out the window, given clubs are seemingly ready to wait until the Red Devils make it clear they’ll accept less than they would currently.

The same has already been said of Marcus Rashford, but less because of his price tag, and more than his favoured destination, Barcelona, are willing to wait until the back end of the summer to make attempts at his signing.
According to reports, Aston Villa are involved in a ‘three-way Premier League battle’ to sign Manchester United outcast Jadon Sancho.
Man Utd have to get busy with new signings but confidence in their ability to raise money through sales seems as woefully misplaced as ever.
Fabrizio Romano has revealed the precise chances that a Manchester United man joins Chelsea, as he has reiterated that the star ‘will leave’ the club.
Man Utd legend Cristiano Ronaldo ‘demanded’ that Al-Nassr signed Alejandro Garnacho this summer during his contract negotiations, according to reports.
According to reports, Arsenal are among the clubs interested in signing Manchester United winger Alejandro Garnacho, who has been linked with Chelsea.
Spurs will have to part with £10m to secure first-choice Ange Postecoglou replacement Thomas Frank and challenge Chelsea’s manager compensation monopoly.

headline: Man Utd hopes of ‘quick-fire’ sale dashed as they’re forced to wait on Euro giants
body: Manchester United will have to wait for a European giant to spring into action in the ‘latter stages’ of the summer transfer window for a sale, so hopes of it being a ‘quick-fire’ on have been dashed.
United could let a number of forwards go this summer. Antony, Alejandro Garnacho, Jadon Sancho and Marcus Rashford are all being linked with exits.

Three of those players were out on loan last season, and though Aston Villa have the option to make Rashford’s loan permanent for £40million, it looks increasingly likely they will swerve that chance.
The winger has looked most likely to head to Barcelona, as he wants to go there, and the LaLiga giants are said to be eager to sign him.
However, if United wanted the deal done quickly so they can receive £40million, they might be out of luck.

GIVEMESPORT reports the club’s hopes of getting Rashford off the books in ‘quick-fire fashion’ have been dealt a blow, as Barca are only planning to enter discussions ‘in the latter stages’ of the summer window.
What’s more, United might not even receive a fee if they go down the Barca route, as they would reportedly ‘prefer to only pursue a loan deal’ if they are able to do business.
It’s said that the Red Devils are ‘desperately searching for a buyer’ for Rashford, so there’s a chance that they do manage to receive a fee for the forward at some point soon.
But if they cannot do so, Barca are prepared to play the waiting game, and there’s a chance they are the only viable location for Rashford by the time the window starts drawing to a close.
That would be less than ideal for United, as it would mean they would not get a big contract off the books permanently, and they’d not receive a fee that they could put towards a replacement player.

They will hope that they can raise funds elsewhere, but they are also desperately searching for a buyer for Antony, and it seems there’s a chance he once again heads out on loan, with Real Betis keen to sign him on loan with an option to buy, meaning there’s no guarantee of payment at all, and if there is, it will come in a year’s time.
A new FC Barcelona transfer target could reportedly  ‘close the door’ on Marcus Rashford’s proposed move from Manchester United to the La Liga giants.
Man Utd have to get busy with new signings but confidence in their ability to raise money through sales seems as woefully misplaced as ever.
Man Utd forward Marcus Rashford has informed his agent that he doesn’t want to sign for any other club this summer apart from Barcelona.
These are the 10 best wide forwards available in the 2025 summer transfer window. Arsenal, Liverpool, Man Utd and Chelsea should be taking notes…
Man Utd have received an offer from Inter Milan for Marcus Rashford which ‘improves’ on Barcelona’s bid for the England international, according to reports.
Aston Villa could pull off a de facto Manchester United swap, as they reportedly want to sign a Red Devils winger if they decide against a permanent raid for Marcus ...

headline: Former Prem boss tells Man Utd they’re ‘desperate’ for 20-goal forward who ‘looks right’ for them
body: Former Premier League manager Alan Pardew has told Manchester United that a forward who scored 20 goals last season “looks right” for them, and they are “desperate” for his services.

United confirmed their first signing of the summer on Thursday. Though it had already been widely suggested that a deal to sign £62.5million forward Matheus Cunha had been agreed with Wolves, it’s now been confirmed.
A transfer for a similar Premier League player has also been in the works at Old Trafford.
United are making attempts to land Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo, though they are stuttering as the Bees are asking for a higher price than the Red Devils are currently willing to pay.
In any case, former manager Pardew feels Mbeumo has to go to United.

“Personally, and I don’t really carry any favour with Spurs or Man United, I’d like to see him in a Man United shirt. There is something about him that I think looks right at Man United,” Pardew told talkSPORT.

“And I think they need him, they’re desperate. We need a big, big Man United. We don’t need a little Man United who can get turned over. The Premier League needs Man United. Just for the historical nitty-gritty, I want a big Man United.

“We want a big Man United, and everyone else can be big as well, but not quite as big as Man United. The situation could be complicated by it, in terms of the boy getting a better deal at Man Utd and maybe Brentford getting a better deal, in terms of the figures going up.

“So even in Brentford’s position, to hold fire wouldn’t be a bad thing because you do want another club involved. You don’t if you’re the buying club like Man Utd are at the moment. They don’t want another club to get involved, but sometimes that happens.”

Indeed, there is a chance that the price gets bumped up given Tottenham interest in Mbeumo. It’s believed that Brentford boss Thomas Frank has signed as Spurs boss, and after it was already suggested he wanted to take the Bees forward with him, he’s been prompted to do so.
Indeed, Jamie O’Hara has said: “Tottenham need to do everything they can to get Mbeumo off United’s hands and reunite him with Frank; he’d be an unbelievable signing, he has everything Spurs need.”
Tottenham Hotspur-bound Thomas Frank has been encouraged to make a “Manchester United hijack” his “first order of business” this summer.
Man Utd are set to make a second “formal bid” for Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo “imminently” as Viktor Gyokeres pushes for a move, according to reports.
Man Utd will get a deal “done” for Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo as his clear preference is the Red Devils over Tottenham, according to reports.
According to reports, Tottenham Hotspur are set to ‘accelerate’ as they look to beat Manchester United in the race to sign Antoine Semenyo.
Premier League giants Manchester United have made an ‘approach’ to sign Arsenal-linked Sporting striker Viktor Gyokeres, according to reports.
Man Utd are set to beat Tottenham to the signing of Brentford winger Bryan Mbeumo “soon” with a deal “advancing”, according to reports.

headline: Fabio Capello feels struggling Man Utd forward is a safe choice for Inter Milan
body: Former England manager Fabio Capello has suggested that a struggling Manchester United forward is a safer signing for Inter Milan than another option.
United had a terrible 2024/25 season. The Red Devils finished 15th in the Premier League – their worst finish ever in the competition.

Their top scorers in the league scored eight goals apiece, and neither were strikers. The highest-scoring striker out of centre-forwards Rasmus Hojlund and Joshua Zirkzee was the former, who bagged four goals in 32 games – one more than the Dutchman in the same amount.
There’s been heavy speculation on the future of the pair, particularly Hojlund.
He has been linked with a move back to Italy – where he played with Atalanta prior to his £72million United signing – with Inter Milan, and Capello feels he’d be a good option.
He wrote in Gazzetta dello Sport: ‘I’ve read a few names, from Hojlund to [Ange-Yoan] Bonny. I’m a fan of the former even if he hasn’t exactly shone at Manchester United.

‘However, the Dane is a very dynamic striker, good at exploiting space. Even though he was very young, he impressed me at Atalanta. Bonny is a different kind of striker, more involved in the build-up play, but probably less ready. Shall I say it? He would be a riskier choice.’
Bonny, at 21, is just a year younger than Hojlund, and just finished a Serie A season for Parma with six goals and four assists.
Hojlund’s only season in Italy saw him back nine Serie A goals and four assists, but his last season in any football was an underwhelming one.
In any case, it is believed that Inter might well make attempts to land Hojlund. It is believed that the Serie A side have tried to sign both the Dane and his United team-mate Zirkzee.
United will reportedly not stand in Hojlund’s way, and a loan with an option or an obligation for Inter to sign him has been suggested.
The Dane is believed to have given his availability to return to Italy and embrace the Inter cause. It’s suggested as a result that the Serie A side will go full steam ahead for the signing.
Man Utd have turned down an approach from Inter Milan for Netherlands international Joshua Zirkzee, according to reports.
Manchester United forward Rasmus Hojlund has been accused of lying as a new report in Italy has revealed an update on his proposed move to Inter Milan.
Man Utd striker Rasmus Hojlund insists he “expects to play” next season at Old Trafford despite reports that he’s been transfer listed by the Red Devils.
Rasmus Hojlund might not be officially up for sale but Manchester United’s transfer ambitions and the striker’s under-par output in 2024-25 could tempt the Red Devils to sell him for ...
According to reports, Inter Milan are ‘confident’ of signing Manchester United star Rasmus Hojlund during this summer’s transfer window.
Tottenham are among the sides interested in an Inter Milan defender, whose price tag is said to be ‘well within reach’ for them, with the Serie A side ‘willing to ...

headline: Transfer rumour power ranking: Liverpool’s Isak alternative, City strike deal to screw Arsenal
body: There’s a new whisper around Liverpool’s pursuit of a forward, while Manchester City are set to beat Arsenal and Villa to an in-demand Scandinavian…
With so much transfer talk doing the rounds, we’re here through the summer to sift through the bullsh*t and highlight the whispers that might have some substance.
Each day we’re ranking the top 20 rumours involving Premier League clubs, the higher the link, the more likely we feel they are to becoming done deals.
So we start with the tittle-tattle…

20) 🆕 Bradley Barcola – PSG to Liverpool
Since Newcastle are selfishly refusing to sell them Alexander Isak, the PSG forward is said to be next on the Reds’ list.  Bayern Munich are also keen on Barcola.

19) Hugo Ekitike – Eintracht Frankfurt to Chelsea
You could substitute Chelsea for Liverpool at any point here while discussing the rumours around Ekitike. Both clubs are interested but each have the same problem: Eintracht Frankfurt and their insistence on £85million.

18) 🔽 Mike Maignan – AC Milan to Chelsea
Chelsea are being weird here. They wanted Maignan in for the Club World Cup but refused to pay more than £10-12million, only just over half the price Milan want to sell the France no.1. Now the Blues can’t take him to USA, they don’t want him at all. That makes such little sense that it probably isn’t as dead as Chelsea want us to believe.

17) 🆕 Victor Osimhen – Napoli to Manchester United
Osimhen apparently fancies a move to Old Trafford, presumably because he’s seen the salaries United have been dishing out in recent years. Napoli want around £70million, though they may take Joshua Zirkzee in part-exchange. This one doesn’t pass the sniff test, unless we get to late in the window with all parties in the same position they are now.

MORE ON THE SUMMER 2025 TRANSFER WINDOW
👉 Every Premier League transfer and release confirmed in the summer of 2025
👉 Twenty biggest transfers in the world in 2025 summer transfer window
👉 Wirtz next? The last five times every Premier League club broke transfer record

15) Luis Diaz – Liverpool to Barcelona
Our reading on this: Barca want Diaz, who would be happy to move to the Nou Camp. Liverpool might be interested in a deal, but only on their terms. Which Barca won’t meet, and Diaz knows it so he won’t kick up a fuss – yet. If this is going to happen, someone needs to change tack. Which doesn’t seem likely any time soon..
MORE: Top 10 wingers available this summer features Arsenal, Liverpool targets and Man Utd outcast

14) Heung-min Son – Tottenham Hotspur to Al-Hilal
The Saudi Arabian club are desperate to make a statement signing and the Spurs captain could be perfect. He’s out of contract next summer, and Son admitted on Tuesday that his future is far from certain.

13) James Trafford – Burnley to Newcastle
Word is that Newcastle and Burnley are haggling over the price of a deal that Eddie Howe wanted to do a year ago, with the intention of Trafford and Nick Pope slugging it out for the No.1 spot. Which rarely ever works. Or at least that’s what Howe might tell Pope, but if this comes off, the current Toon keeper’s days are numbered. So Pope might be happy to hear that the two clubs are some way off an agreement with Burnley said to be asking for £40million.

12) 🆕 Oleksandr Zinchenko – Arsenal to AC Milan
Zinchenko has been surplus to requirements for some time and with a year remaining on his contract, Arsenal are motivated to sell. One problem: his fat salary is too rich for Milan’s taste. If they can overcome that obstacle, this definitely fits.

11) Antoine Semenyo – Bournemouth to Tottenham Hotspur
The Cherries reportedly want £70m, which feels unrealistic. A transfer still feels inevitable and Man United, Liverpool and Spurs have all been linked and Londoners are the favourites.

10) 🆕 Wilfried Ndidi – Leicester to Manchester United
The Nigeria midfielder has a £9million release clause and United see him as a good value squad addition to bolster their midfield options, especially if they sell Casemiro this summer. Which makes sense. Everton and the Saudis are also sniffing.

9) 🔽 Benjamin Sesko – RB Leipzig to Arsenal
The Slovenia striker had overtaken Gyokeres as the favourite to fill the gaping chasm in the centre of Arsenal’s attack after much deliberation on the Gunners’ part. But perhaps they hadn’t accounted for how much of a slog it would be to negotiate with RB Leipzig, who are refusing to accept anything under their £70million valuation. As is their right. Especially when Al-Hilal seem keen to cough up if Sesko can be convinced to move to Saudi.

8) Viktor Gyokeres – Sporting to Manchester United
With Arsenal going cold on Gyokeres, there were plenty of reports that the Swede is open to a move to Old Trafford after all. Sporting say they haven’t received any offers and they also insist that reports of a gentleman’s agreement for him to leave for £59million are b*llocks. Which Gyokeres disputes. This could get messy.

7) Bryan Mbeumo – Brentford to Manchester United
Tottenham’s renewed interest threatened to scupper United’s hopes of landing Mbeumo but even the prospect of following Thomas Frank to Spurs isn’t deterring the forward from pursuing a move to Old Trafford. He’ll get his way ‘soon’, apparently.

6) 🔼 Jamie Gittens – Borussia Dortmund to Chelsea
Chelsea’s improved offer has been swiftly rejected. But a third is expected despite the distraction of the Club World Cup for Chelsea and Dortmund. Gittens is keeping his phone on
5) Kepa Arrizabalaga – Chelsea to Arsenal
This one was moving quick, apparently, with Arsenal aware that the world’s most expensive goalkeeper will cost them just £5million. Interesting one, this. Kepa recovered some credibility on loan at Bournemouth last season and won’t be going to Arsenal just to play second fiddle to David Raya. Bring on the Gunners goalie wars!

4) Martin Zubimendi – Real Sociedad to Arsenal
This one got the ‘Here we go’ treatment over a month ago but then it all went a bit quiet. And then there was talk of Real Madrid sticking their nose in. Fear not, though, Gooners. Ornstein says it’s done.

3) Milos Kerkez – Bournemouth to Liverpool
Word last week was it’s happening. For around £40million. Which represents decent business for both sides. Things have gone a little quiet since while Liverpool pursue Wirtz but seemingly there is nothing or Reds to worry about here.

2) 🔼 Sverre Nypan – Rosenborg to Manchester City
Arsenal fancied their chances of landing the Norwegian wonderkid, and Villa were in talks in recent months. But City are in the mood for signings and it looks like they have agreed a £12.5million deal for the 18-year-old attacking midfielder.

1) 🔼 Florian Wirtz – Bayer Leverkusen to Liverpool
Liverpool will reportedly pay a British record £126.9m for Wirtz. That’s a lot of wonga. Is Rayan Cherki for a quarter of the price the better transfer? It might just be…
👉 Five reasons why Florian Wirtz may not actually be a good signing for Liverpool

headline: Tottenham, Frank told to make Man Utd hijack his ‘first order of business’ with ‘agreement struck’
body: Tottenham Hotspur-bound Thomas Frank has been encouraged to make a “Manchester United hijack” his “first order of business” this summer.
The Athletic’s David Ornstein revealed on Thursday afternoon that the Premier League giants are closing in on appointing Frank, who is set to replace former boss Ange Postecoglou.
There has been a ‘hold up’ as Spurs and Brentford have discussed respected coach Justin Cochrane moving with Frank as each club were keen to secure his services.
However, Ornstein has confirmed that Tottenham have overcome issues with an ‘agreement struck’ for Frank and Cochrane.
Ornstein revealed:
‘Tottenham Hotspur are set to seal the appointment of Thomas Frank as head coach after managing to secure the highly-rated Justin Cochrane as his assistant.
‘The deal was held up by the situation of Cochrane, who Brentford wanted to keep and had admiration from elsewhere — but he decided to join Tottenham.’
READ: Thomas Frank sack incoming as Spurs and football are stupid, mate
Spurs and Frank have a busy summer as they prepare for a season in the Champions League as they need to make some statement signings after finishing 17th in the Premier League.

It has been suggested that they are interested in Brentford star Bryan Mbeumo and ex-Spurs midfielder Jamie O’Hara has told his former club to “hijack Man Utd” in the race to sign the forward, who scored 20 Premier League goals in 2024/25.
“Thomas Frank’s first order of business should be to hijack Bryan Mbeumo’s move to Manchester Utd,” O’Hara told Grosvenor Sport.
“Tottenham need to do everything they can to get Mbeumo off United’s hands and reunite him with Frank; he’d be an unbelievable signing, he has everything Spurs need.
“The current squad and players aren’t good enough to compete for Europe with the likes of Newcastle and Aston Villa.

“The target for next season should be getting back into the top six and giving the fans good football to watch every week. Structured formations and organised football have been missing for the last two seasons, and that’s what Spurs need if they’re to challenge in the top half of the table.”

MORE SPURS COVERAGE ON F365…
